title: Congress targets government over ‚Äòorganic cotton scam‚Äô, demands probe
content: Congress leader Digvijay Singh alleged that there has been a ‚Çπ2.1 lakh crore scam involving ‚Äòfake‚Äô organic cotton and some traders have made six-fold profits; he demanded an investigation into the matter

title: India‚Äôs rising stature would lead to national security challenges in years to come: Home Minister Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah was speaking at the conclusion of the two-day 8th National Security Strategies (NSS) Conference-2025 organised by the Intelligence Bureau (IB), which was attended by 800 police and intelligence officers

title: Study recommends two half-dose combination of drugs in a single pill for good blood pressure control in Indians
content: All three combinations, in patients aged 30‚Äì79, delivered equivalent BP reductions and similar rates of BP control, researchers said; all combinations were equally safe and effective with high tolerability over six months, they wrote in the paper

title: Air India disburses interim compensation to families of Ahmedabad crash victims
content: Compensation paid to kin of 166 victims; process under way for remaining 52; airline sets up memorial trust

title: Vellappally Natesan slams Satheeshan
content: The SNDP Yogam general secretary calls the Opposition leader anti-Ezhava and says he is not capable of leading the UDF

title: BJP slams SP MLA for saying that only illiterate people go on Kanwar Yatra
content: The Samajwadi Party is once again attempting to stoke division in a desperate bid to stay politically relevant, alleged the BJP¬†

title: Trinamool Congress MP refutes Haryana CM charge against Bengal CM on migrant workers
content: Trinamool Congress MP and chairperson of West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board Samirul Islam on Saturday says a witch-hunt is going on against migrants in the name of ‚ÄòBangladeshis‚Äô

title: Tej Pratap Yadav to contest Bihar Assembly election as independent candidate from Mahua
content: Following a recent controversy involving a video of his relationship with a woman, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav‚Äôs elder son was expelled from the party, and ousted from his family

title: PM Modi inaugurates projects worth ‚Çπ4,900 crore in Tamil Nadu
content: Prime Minister Modi launches multiple projects in Tamil Nadu, including new airport terminal, extended runway, and cargo berthing facility

title: Thiruvananthapuram DCC president Palode Ravi resigns after leaked phone call embarrasses party¬†
content: The discussion about the possibility of the LDF returning to power again in 2026 and the BJP striking deeper, making electoral gains in the Assembly elections, puts the Congress on the defensive. The tape also had disparaging predictions¬†about¬†the Congress faring poorly in the local body polls later this year

title: 'Weapons made in India keeping masters of terrorism awake': PM Modi on Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted the role of indigenous weapons in Operation Sindoor, emphasizing their impact on terrorism. He launched development projects in Tamil Nadu, including a new terminal at Thoothukudi Airport and road projects, aiming to boost infrastructure and economic growth. The India-UK Free Trade Agreement is expected to significantly benefit Tamil Nadu's economy, particularly for youth and small businesses.

title: From 0/2 to hope renewed: Shubman Gill, KL Rahul rewrite a doomed script at Old Trafford
content: India faced a tough situation early on Day 4, losing two quick wickets after seeing England take 311 run lead. Shubman Gill and KL Rahul then mounted a strong fightback, forging an as-yet unbroken 174-run partnership. Their resilience ensured India go into Day 5 with a chance, setting up a thrilling finish.

title: IND vs ENG: Will Pant bat on Day 5? India coach Kotak shares latest updates
content: India face more injury issues in the Test series against England. Rishabh Pant hurt his toe and cannot keep wicket. Dhruv Jurel replaced him. However, according to India batting coach Shitanshu Kotak, Pant will bat in the second innings. Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep were ruled out of the fourth Test earlier due to injury. KL Rahul and Shubman Gill batted well after an early collapse on Day 4.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Rare earth supply risk: Indian firms flag Chinese curbs; can Beijing afford ban?
content: Indian electronics manufacturers are facing challenges in meeting production targets under the ECMS due to rare earth mineral shortages caused by Chinese export restrictions. Companies have raised concerns with MeitY, seeking leniency and exploring alternative sourcing. While the government considers extending the application window, the industry remains hopeful for a resolution to the supply chain disruptions.

title: Are more job cuts coming? Is he feeling guilty about... : Microsoft employees to CEO's memo
content: Microsoft employees are reportedly skeptical of CEO Satya Nadella's memo addressing recent layoffs amidst substantial profits and AI investments. The company has eliminated around 15,000 positions this year, despite a $75 billion profit over three fiscal quarters.

title: IND vs ENG: History for KL Rahul! India batter becomes first-ever opener in 46 years to ...
content: KL Rahul makes history. He is the first Indian opener in 46 years to score 500+ runs in an away Test series. He is India's second-highest run-scorer in this series, behind Shubman Gill. Rahul's consistency shines despite tough conditions. England lead the series 2-1, with Rahul's achievement a bright spot for India. His runs are a positive takeaway amid a challenging series.

title: Nvidia CEO: Don't feel sad for my employees; I've created more billionaires than...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: Chess | Divya devastated in World Cup final draw against Humpy - Watch
content: The first game of the FIDE Women‚Äôs World Cup final witnessed a tense draw between Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy in Batumi. Despite a promising start with the white pieces, Divya's initial advantage slipped as Humpy showcased her experience with precise defense. The 41-move game concluded through repetition, leaving Divya visibly disappointed for missing an early opportunity.

title: Mumbai-Pune eway crash: 1 dead, 18 hurt as truck rams 20 vehicles
content: A high-speed container trailer truck, suspected to have suffered brake failure, caused a major pile-up on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway near the Adoshi tunnel. The incident involved approximately 20 vehicles, including luxury cars, resulting in one woman's death and injuries to at least 18 others.

title: India-US trade deal: Piyush Goyal shares important update on negotiations
content: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal announced that trade agreement talks with the US are progressing rapidly, with the next negotiation round scheduled for August in India. Both nations aim to finalize the initial agreement tranche by fall, targeting a significant boost to bilateral trade from $191 billion to $500 billion.

title: 'Leave me out of it': YesJulz speaks out; LeBron slammed for dancing to Drake diss amid rumours
content: LeBron James ignited controversy by dancing to Kendrick Lamar's Drake diss track in Cannes, drawing social media influencer YesJulz into the fray. Years after infidelity rumors involving James surfaced, YesJulz has now broken her silence, posting "Leave me out of it" on X. The rumors began in 2014 when James played for the Miami Heat.

title: 'Your son is different': Gisele says son Benjamin was bullied; recounts struggling
content: Gisele Bundchen revealed her son Benjamin faced bullying in Boston for being Tom Brady's son. Benjamin prefers surfing and skiing. Tom Brady initially struggled with his son's disinterest in football. Gisele emphasized supporting children's individual paths. The family embraces co-parenting. Jack, Tom's eldest son, is interested in football. The story highlights navigating expectations and individuality within a famous family.

title: Vanessa breaks silence on pregnancy rumours: Shares Rihanna meme; internet can‚Äôt get enough
content: Vanessa Bryant addressed pregnancy rumors with a playful Instagram Story featuring Rihanna, shutting down speculation with humor and a clear message about protecting her peace. She emphasized the importance of inner character over material possessions, sharing motivational quotes and highlighting her focus on family and philanthropy. Bryant's response underscored her right to privacy amidst public scrutiny.

title: Asia Cup 2025: India's fixtures announced; when is IND vs PAK?
content: India's path to the 2025 Asia Cup is confirmed, with the tournament set in the UAE from September 9-28. India will face Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in Group A, starting against UAE on September 10. A highly anticipated India vs. Pakistan match is scheduled for September 14, with potential further clashes in the Super 4s and final.

title: Chess | WC Final: Divya lets advantage slip, holds Humpy to draw
content: The first game of the Women‚Äôs Chess World Cup final saw a draw between Divya Deshmukh and Koneru Humpy in Batumi. Divya, playing white, surprised with a new opening, while Humpy's experience ensured a balanced game. Despite tense moments and repeated checks, neither player could break through, setting the stage for a gripping contest.

title: 'Saiyaara‚Äô BO collection day 9 (Live): Mohit Suri‚Äôs film set to cross Rs 200cr?
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office sensation, poised to cross Rs 200 crore on its second Saturday. The film's strong emotional narrative and music have resonated with audiences, propelling it into the Top 50 Hindi films. Akshay Kumar praised the film, highlighting the success of fresh talent in Bollywood.

title: Affair & poisoning: How missing bottle cap exposed 'suicide' as murder; wife, lover held
content: Initially appearing as a suicide near Kanva dam, the death of Lokesh Kumar, a former gram panchayat president, was cleverly disguised. However, observant police officers noticed missing details like the poison bottle cap and a missing slipper, raising suspicions.

title: Cash recovery row: SC to hear Justice Varma's plea against impeachment
content: The Supreme Court will hear Justice Yashwant Varma's petition on July 28, challenging an inquiry committee's findings and a recommendation for his impeachment. The controversy arose after a fire at his Delhi residence led to the discovery of a large sum of cash.

title: Students to learn about Op Sindoor‚Äôs military triumph in new NCERT module
content: NCERT is developing an educational module on ‚ÄòOperation Sindoor‚Äô to educate schoolchildren about India's military capabilities and technological advancements. The module, designed for Classes 3 to 12, will highlight India's defence readiness, scientific progress, and growing global stature. It will also cover themes like Mission LiFE, the Partition's horrors, and India's space achievements, including Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's ISS visit.

title: NHL players acquitted in sexual assault case: probe on; team undecided on next steps
content: Despite the acquittal of Michael McLeod, Carter Hart, Dillon Dube, Cal Foote, and Alex Formenton in a 2018 sexual assault case, the NHL has maintained their suspension, sparking conflict with the NHL Players Association. The league stated the players remain ineligible pending a review of the judge's findings, citing disturbing allegations even if not criminal.

title: 'Ashamed to support Bihar govt': Chirag Paswan flays NDA ally Nitish over rising crime
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan has criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over the state's deteriorating law and order situation, even while his party remains a part of the NDA. Paswan's remarks follow a series of high-profile crimes in Bihar, leading the opposition to highlight potential rifts within the ruling alliance.

title: Cops bust int'l cartel run on delivery app model; gang used women as carriers
content: Delhi Police cracked down on a significant drug trafficking operation. They seized drugs worth over Rs 100 crore. Five foreign nationals got arrested. The syndicate operated across multiple countries. It used encrypted channels and forged documents. The police recovered cocaine, MDMA, and OG ganja. The investigation revealed a complex money laundering scheme. Authorities are further investigating the network.

title: Easier path to Green Card? US lawmaker to table bill in Senate soon - but will it pass?
content: Senator Alex Padilla is set to introduce a bill offering a green card pathway to immigrants who have resided in the US for at least seven years, have no criminal record, and meet other requirements. This initiative aims to update the Immigration and Nationality Act, potentially benefiting over 8 million people, including Dreamers and skilled workers facing green card backlogs.

title: Mumbai mishap: Car plunges into ditch after driver follows Google Maps; rescued
content: In Navi Mumbai's Belapur, a woman driving an Audi was rescued early Friday after her car plunged into a ditch around 1:00 am. She was reportedly following Google Maps directions when she took a wrong turn under a bridge, leading her into the water.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day: Hera Pheri 3 back on track & more
content: Sandeep Reddy Vanga regrets cutting emotional scenes from 'Animal,' while Akshay Kumar confirms 'Hera Pheri 3' is back with the original cast. Ekta Kapoor distances herself from the banned OTT platform ALTT, clarifying her departure in 2021. Amidst Saiyaara‚Äôs success, Aneet Padda denies nepotism claims, and Farah Khan seemingly critiques Deepika Padukone's demand for shorter work shifts.

title: Low insurance costs, affordable treatment and medicines drawing NRIs to India
content: A Policybazaar report reveals a surge in NRIs seeking medical treatment in India, driven by significantly lower costs. Health insurance purchases by NRIs have jumped 150% in 2024-25. Treatment costs in India can be 60-90% less than in the US, with heart bypass surgery costing Rs 4.5-8 lakh compared to Rs 60 lakh-1.3 crore in the US.

title: Bihar: Woman faints during home guard recruitment drive; 'gang-raped' inside ambulance
content: A shocking incident occurred in Gaya district, Bihar. A 26-year-old woman reported a gang-rape. The crime allegedly happened in a moving ambulance. She collapsed during a Home Guard recruitment drive. The incident took place on July 24th. Police arrested two men swiftly after receiving the complaint. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Michael Pezzetta wins over Maple Leafs fans with surprise visit to Youth Hockey camp
content: Michael Pezzetta, a Toronto native, has signed a two-year, $1.625 million deal with the Maple Leafs, adding physicality to their bottom-six. He recently engaged with young fans at the Maple Leafs youth hockey camp, demonstrating his commitment to the community. Pezzetta's return home brings excitement to his family and friends, all avid Leafs supporters.

title: Josh Allen reacts: Sister‚Äôs baby line drops with No. 17 twist ‚Äî Bills fans gush online
content: Josh Allen's sister, Nicala Madden, launched a baby clothing line called Little Dreamers Co., featuring a special collection named "17 Sideline Snuggles" as a tribute to Allen's jersey number. The Buffalo Bills quarterback expressed his pride and support for his sister's new venture.

title: Reports on officials, religion, protests land journalists in trouble; those in towns most impacted, finds study
content: A study said that a journalist‚Äôs experience of the justice system differed based on location and status. Journalists in major metropolises were arrested in 24% of the incidents, this increased to 58% for journalists in small cities and towns.

title: Defending need for SIR in the Supreme Court, Election Commission cites parties‚Äô complaints about voter list errors
content: In its counter affidavit filed in the SC, the ECI cites complaints made by AAP, Congress, BJP, AIADMK, Shiv Sena; ECI says it began the SIR ‚Äúto restore puiblic confidence in the integrity of the electoral roll‚Äù

title: Closely monitoring situation: India on Thailand-Cambodia clashes
content: The Indian mission in the Thai capital urged all Indian travellers to check updates from authorities in the country before visiting tourist attractions in troubled areas.

title: State Election Commission gets over 1 lakh applications for fresh enrolment on voters list in the first three days
content: State Election Commission Commission has given time till August 7 for the public to include their names, rectify errors or make changes in the entries

title: T.N. Forest Dept. restores unused stretch of intertidal barren land along Uppanar River in Cuddalore
content: Steps have been initiated to form a Village Mangrove Committee at Kudikadu to further strengthen local participation and protective mechanisms, says B. Iqbal, Forest Range Officer. This committee will involve local stakeholders in protection, maintenance, and awareness activities related to the mangrove ecosystem

title: Issue guidelines within three months for safe collection, transport of medical samples, Delhi HC tells Centre
content: Currently, India lacks specific regulations governing how medical samples, such as blood, urine, or swabs, are collected, stored, and transported to diagnostic laboratories, a regulatory gap that has led to serious concerns

title: Houses damaged as trees fall on them in heavy rain in Thrissur
content: District administration opens three relief camps, where 132 people from 33 families are currently housed. Authorities asked to take pre-emptive measures against landslides and manage dam openings with utmost caution

title: Rajasthan govt. announces ‚Çπ10 lakh each to kin of children killed in Jhalawar school building collapse
content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma also announced an increase from 15% to 20% in the permissible allocation for these buildings in the Dang, Magra and Mewat regions.

title: For five tribal settlements in Munnar, proper road is a distant dream
content: Children in the settlements are sent to hostels at the age of five so that they can attend schools. Those in need of medical care are carried on stretchers to hospitals in Marayur. People say a motorable road on a 13-km stretch would solve the problem, but blame the Forest dept. for hampering the project.

title: With groundwater turning saline and taps running dry, clean drinking water is a luxury at Pazhayar
content: TWAD Board supplies water to the village once in 10 days; officials say illegal drawal of water from the pipeline to the village is a major challenge and they are looking into it

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari to launch protest for ‚ÄòBengali Hindu homeland‚Äô, targets ‚Äòinfiltrators‚Äô
content: BJP Leader of Opposition alleges large-scale infiltration and voter list manipulation in West Bengal; calls for revision of electoral roll

title: Sigandoor temple trust seeks 4.19 hectares of forestland in sanctuary for its activities
content: Sigandoor temple trust claims it built guest houses, dining halls, and other structures on the forestland before it knew the land belonged to the Forest Department

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide blocks Kedarnath route near Gaurikund; pilgrims halted
content: The trekking route to Kedarnath Dham, near Gaurikund, has been closed due to a landslide triggered by a hillock collapse on Friday night. The Public Works Department is working to clear the debris and restore the path. Security personnel are assisting pilgrims returning from Kedarnath, while those heading towards the shrine from Gaurikund have been stopped.

title: Prada-Kolhapuri row: Piyush Goyal says India will get due credit for its design
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that India will receive due recognition for its unique cultural products under the new FTA with the UK, citing the Prada-Kolhapuri chappal controversy. The government aims to protect and promote Indian GI products in global markets, with potential for significant international business.

title: Piyush Goyal lauds India-UK FTA; calls it 'stepping stone towards Viksit Bharat'
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the newly signed India-UK FTA as a "game-changing" agreement, offering significant opportunities for Indian farmers, businesses, and youth. The comprehensive FTA, awaiting UK Parliamentary approval, aims to eliminate duties on 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

title: 90 firearms, 728 ammunition, explosives seized from 5 districts of Manipur‚Äôs Imphal Valley
content: A senior police officer said that several of the seized firearms were reportedly looted from police armouries after ethnic conflict erupted in the State in May 202

title: Heavy rain, gusty winds lash central Travancore
content: Rain-related incidents reported in 54 villages across Kottayam, with 172 houses sustaining partial damage. Electricity supply remained disrupted at many locations. Two relief camps opened in Kottayam, three in Thiruvalla, Pathanamthitta.

title: Cast-off capital
content: ¬†Over the past two decades Panipat, a city in Haryana known in Indian history for three major battles, has emerged as one of Asia‚Äôs largest processors of textile waste. Ashok Kumar finds that the city has a large number of illegal bleaching and dyeing units, essential in the conversion of scrap cloth into low-quality thread. These units discharge contaminated water into drains that merge with the Yamuna river

title: Shashi Tharoor draws praise from Church
content: The praise from Syro-Malabar Catholic Church bishops at the platinum jubilee celebrations of the Pala diocese was all the more striking given that it came in the presence of KPCC  president Sunny Joseph.

title: HRW has highlighted illegal deportation of Bengali-speaking people, says Mamata
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee takes to social media and said the Human Rights Watch has released a report saying Bengali-speaking Indians are being abused and pushed out in a concerted manner by the BJP establishment

title: Mandatory to conduct audit of safety in schools: Govt tells states, UTs
content: ‚ÄúStructural integrity, along with fire safety, emergency exits, and electrical wiring, must be thoroughly assessed,‚Äù a senior MoE official said

title: Deadlock over Aranmula Vallasadya deepens as PSS threatens protests
content: Palliyoda Seva Sangham has objected to the move to hold the event inside the temple premises; terms it a serious violation of the temple‚Äôs traditions and rituals

title: Chirag Paswan regrets supporting Bihar government in view of deteriorating law and order in the State
content: The MP from Hajipur, and Union Minister of Food Processing Industries, accused the State government, of which he is an alliance partner, of ‚Äòeither trying to hush up the situation or being unable to handle it any more‚Äô

title: Congress accuses the government of doing ‚Äòpetty politics‚Äô over the motion to remove Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The party quotes former Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar‚Äôs July 21 statement to argue that the notice, signed by 63 Opposition members, had been admitted by the Chair, after reports claim that the Opposition-backed notice had not been admitted in the Upper House

title: Source: Texans' Mixon out majority of preseason
content: Texans running back Joe Mixon will miss a majority of the preseason with an ankle injury and will be reevaluated closer to the start of the regular season, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Source: Titans' Burks suffers fractured collarbone
content: Titans receiver Treylon Burks suffered a fractured collarbone while attempting a one-handed grab during practice Saturday, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Hamilton: Spa qualifying result 'unacceptable'
content: Lewis Hamilton labeled his performance at the Belgian Grand Prix "unacceptable," saying he had to look internally to find answers about a miserable week so far.

title: Dolphins sign CBs Jones, Hilton after Burns injury
content: The Dolphins have signed free agent cornerbacks Jack Jones and Mike Hilton, making the moves in the wake of Artie Burns tearing an ACL.

title: Steelers adding Ben, Pouncey, Porter to team hall
content: Ben Roethlisberger, his longtime center Maurkice Pouncey and linebacker Joey Porter Sr. will be inducted into the Steelers' hall of honor during a December game.

title: Arsenal pays $86M for coveted striker Gy√∂keres
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of highly sought-after striker Viktor Gy√∂keres from Sporting CP, the club announced on Saturday.

title: Miami: Messi 'extremely upset' with MLS over ban
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said Lionel Messi is "extremely upset" after being given a one-game suspension by MLS for skipping the All-Star Game.

title: VA Tech probing tampering claim by NC Central
content: Virginia Tech says it is looking into a tampering claim made by NC Central coach Trei Oliver, who said a Hokies assistant attended an Eagles game in an effort to recruit their star running back.

title: üèà Favorite fantasy football breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Building the perfect trade deadline for the Mets and Phillies
content: New York and Philadelphia are battling for NL East domination. Here's how each can win next week's trade deadline.

content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: Baker Mayfield judges contest featuring mullets, mustaches and Crocs in 'sport mode'
content: The Buccaneers QB handed out a custom trophy -- with a mullet, mustache and all -- to the fan who best captured his undercover alter ego from "The Undercovers."

title: Euro 2025 final preview: England vs. Spain, tactics, players, prediction
content: England and Spain have done this before: The Euro 2025 final is a rerun of the final from the 2023 World Cup, so we're in familiar territory.

title: How Arsenal's new signing Viktor Gy√∂keres became Europe's top striker
content: Viktor Gy√∂keres was in England's second tier a few years ago but he was Europe's top goal scorer last season and is now a major addition for Arsenal.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: How Inter Miami signed De Paul and fit him in MLS' strict roster rules
content: With MLS' roster rules severely limiting Inter Miami's spending, how have the Herons managed to sign another high-impact -- and high-earning -- friend of Lionel Messi's?

title: Ranking the 25 best soccer teams of the past 25 years: A non-English, non-Spanish team is No. 1
content: Let's pick the 25 best teams since 2000. How many Liverpool, Barcelona, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich squads make the list?

content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 1 Saniyah Hall to USC.

title: Key stats and numbers for Zayas-Garcia and 'Shu Shu'-Heita
content: Xander Zayas fights for his first world title, and Bruce Carrington for an interim belt. Here's a look at both fights through the numbers.

title: Top highlights: Terry 'Hulk Hogan' Bollea was a pioneer in the world of professional wrestling
content: Hulk Hogan is arguably the most well-known professional wrestler of all time. Check out his top career accolades now.

title: Barnwell's everything-on-the-line team: 15 players and coaches with the most to gain -- or lose
content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Man United considering Kolo Muani in striker search
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: PLL Week 9 preview: Key stats, players for Archers' Homecoming
content: The PLL heads back to Salt Lake City on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: PM Modi Most Popular Democratic Leader With 75% Approval Rating: Survey
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has emerged as the world's most popular democratic leader with a 75% approval rating, according to a recent global survey conducted by US-based data analytics firm Morning Consult.

title: Focus On Drugs-Free India, Ensure Better Coordination: Amit Shah To Agencies
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah addressed the Eighth National Security Strategies Conference (NSSC) in New Delhi, marking the conclusion of the two-day meet on Kargil Vijay Diwas.

title: India Will Retaliate If Proposed Carbon Tax Harms Domestic Exports: Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said India will "react and retaliate" if the UK imposes a carbon tax in the future that harms domestic exports.

title: Jagan Reddy's Firm Searched By Probe Agency In Case Linked To Liquor Scam
content: A cement company owned by former Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was searched by the crime investigation department (CID) in Hyderabad on Saturday.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Projects Worth Rs 4,800 Crore In Tamil Nadu
content: Landing in Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi on Saturday, returning from his overseas trip, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation for projects worth Rs 4,800 crore.

title: 4 Of Family Die By Suicide In Madhya Pradesh, Note Recovered: Cops
content: Four members of a family died by suicide in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district, police said on Saturday.

title: NASA To Lose About 20% Of Staff Amid Trump's Federal Workforce Cuts
content: The US space agency NASA will lose about 3,900 employees under Donald Trump's sweeping effort to trim the federal workforce -- at the same time as the president prioritizes plans for crewed missions to the Moon and Mars.

title: "Pollution Should Be The Criteria": Minister On Old Vehicles' Ban In Delhi
content: The Delhi government has approached the Supreme Court seeking a review of its 2018 order, which bans diesel vehicles older than 10 years and petrol vehicles older than 15 years in the Delhi-NCR region.

title: US Panel Probes Epstein Sex Trafficking Case, Pressure Mounts On Trump Administration
content: A key House committee is looking into the investigation of the late Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking crimes, working to subpoena President Donald Trump's Department of Justice for files in the case.

title: Fired Immigration Judges Vow To Fight Back Against Trump Administration Terminations
content: Federal immigration judges fired by the Trump administration are filing appeals, pursuing legal action and speaking out in an unusually public campaign to fight back.

title: "Not A Theatre": Madhya Pradesh Bans Protests, Slogans In State Assembly
content: Can elected representatives protest in Madhya Pradesh assembly? The state secretariat has answered in the negative.

title: Woman Killed After Truck Rams Over 25 Vehicles On Mumbai-Pune Expressway
content: A woman was killed and 21 others were injured in an accident on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, which involved nearly 25 vehicles.

title: BJP MP Seeks Bharat Ratna For Poet Bhikhari Thakur Ahead of Bihar Polls
content: BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has written to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, demanding that Bhikhari Thakur, the legendary Bhojpuri poet, playwright, singer, and social reformer, be posthumously awarded the Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian honour.

title: Trump Calls For Ceasefire, Compares India-Pakistan Conflict With Cambodia-Thailand Clash
content: US President Donald Trump said Saturday he was talking with the leaders of Cambodia and Thailand in a bid to end their border conflict that has left at least 33 people dead.

title: Air India Pays Interim Aid To Families Of 166 Ahmedabad Crash Victims
content: Private carrier Air India on Saturday said it has paid the interim compensation to the families of 166 victims of the Ahmedabad plane crash last month.

title: Medical Body IMA Flags Over Rs 1.21 Lakh Crore Unpaid Bills Under Ayushman Bharat
content: Over 9.84 crore hospital admissions have been approved under the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY), with payments exceeding Rs 1.40 lakh crore, the government informed parliament on Friday.

title: After Aerospace, Quantum Computing Tussle Erupts Between Andhra Pradesh And Karnataka
content: The two neighbouring states and the governments are at it once again. The competitive spirit between Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka has now spilled into the realm of quantum technology, with a fresh war of words erupting between the two neighbours.

title: "CPM Will Win": Row Over Kerala Congress Leader's Leaked Phone Conversation
content: Palode Ravi resigned from his post on Saturday following "embarrassment caused to the party after he predicted a poor performance" for the Congress in the upcoming local body and Assembly elections.

title: 'Historic' Trade Deal With UK Shows World's Trust In India: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday described the recently concluded FTA between India and UK as 'historic,' and said the trade pact showed the world's trust in the country.

title: Journalist Ready To Put Camera, Shield On Sale For Food, As Gaza Starves
content: In a recent LinkedIn post, Gaza-based photojournalist Mohammed Abo Oun revealed that he is selling his camera equipment and press shield in order to buy food for his family.

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .
